Introduction to Economics

Learn the basics of microeconomics and macroeconomics to understand markets and economies.

About This Course

This course introduces freshman students to the fundamentals of economics, covering microeconomics, macroeconomics, and economic analysis. Designed to build a strong foundation, it prepares you for advanced studies and understanding global economic systems.

What You'll Learn

  • Understand key principles of microeconomics, like supply and demand.
  • Explore macroeconomic concepts, such as GDP and inflation.
  • Develop skills to analyze economic data and policies.
  • Apply economic thinking to real-world issues.

Course Content

Lesson 1: Microeconomics Basics

Learn about supply, demand, and market structures.

Lesson 2: Macroeconomics Fundamentals

Explore GDP, inflation, and economic policies.

Lesson 3: Economic Analysis

Develop skills to interpret economic data and trends.
